definition: to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Tripoli today is a tale of two cities.
sentences.chinese: 的黎波里今天上演雙城記。

sentences.english: The programme is to be broadcast in four episodes, culminating on Easter Sunday with the Resurrection.
sentences.chinese: 該節目共有四集，復活節將上演最後一集基督的復活。

sentences.english: The drama group did a sketch about a couple buying a new car.
sentences.chinese: 劇社上演了一出夫妻二人買新車的短劇。

sentences.english: Thee love of royal celebrities has always been staged for the world to see.
sentences.chinese: 皇室名流們的愛情總是如戲劇般上演，受到世人矚目。

sentences.english: Explicit sex is on show in the temples, while the movies don't even get to first base.
sentences.chinese: 露骨的性愛在寺廟裏上演，而電影甚至不能達到一壘。

sentences.english: They will play a stage—show , wish all the people in snow .
sentences.chinese: 他們會上演一臺舞臺劇，祝福所有貯立雪中的人。

sentences.english: The two co-star as husband and wife in the upcoming film Dream House, slated for a fall release.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆將在秋季上演的電影《惡靈凶宅》中扮演夫妻。

sentences.english: At present, they are visiting all parts of the country. They will be arriving here tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 目前他們正在全國各地巡迴上演，今天就要抵達此地。

sentences.english: The cast of the musical reprised the theme song for the last act of the show.
sentences.chinese: 音樂劇演員重新演奏了上演最後一幕的主題歌。

sentences.english: Exhibition floors were chock-a-block with racing and sports cars.
sentences.chinese: 上演場地上讓比賽車塞得滿滿的。

sentences.english: There's a film premiere for some big movie in Leicester Square.
sentences.chinese: 會在萊斯特廣場上演電影鉅作的首映式。

sentences.english: Several new plays will be performed on National Day.
sentences.chinese: 國慶日將上演幾個新戲。

sentences.english: Can he play Lazarus one last time?
sentences.chinese: 現在他能最後一次上演絕地反擊嗎？

sentences.english: Last Saturday, there was a scary movie on TV.
sentences.chinese: 上個星期六，電視上演了一部恐怖電影。

sentences.english: Alternatively, they may simply ‘watch’ the dream unfold.
sentences.chinese: 或者，他們也許只是“靜觀”夢境的上演。

sentences.english: First love is singing about vernal blazing passion, performing our young maturation.
sentences.chinese: 初戀吟唱着青春熾烈的激情，上演着我們青澀的成熟。

definition: large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
clash that leaves both sides shattered
to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
the curtain drops/the end of the show
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
